title: Onite 2PCS LED Strip Dimmer Switch, USB Female to Male Extension Cord with Dimmable Rotary Switch

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #121,183 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #235 in Dimmer Switches       #235 in Dimmer Switches

shipping_info: FREE Wednesday, June 11 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Dimmer Switches
feature_bullets: Easy to use: just use your finger to touch the power icon,it is be widely used in led lamp adjust brightness.
The touch time is less than 3 second, it is on/off switch function. The touch time is more than 3 second, it is dimming function, the brightness will be raise to highest or fallen to lowest.
Maximum current: 2A, ideal for led cabinet light, led rigid bar, led strip and led panel light and USB fun.
The cord length is 1m in total,including the touch panel.
Package include: 2 Pieces of Dimmer Cord

customers_say: Customers find the dimmer switch works well with LED strip lights and effectively dims them, with one customer noting it smoothly adjusts without issues. The product is easy to use and simple to install, and customers appreciate its lifespan, with one mentioning it makes lights last twice as long. The build quality receives mixed feedback, with some finding it well-made while others express disappointment with quality control. Customers disagree on whether the switch turns off completely, and several find it bulky.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLED dimmer for neon art
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: This dimmer helps faux “neon” led lighting take the proper place in a room for atmosphere and lighting art!

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2024

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazingly better than I ever expected
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
customer_reviews.review_snippet: So many times, USB gadgetry is disappointing.  This dimmer has been in use for over 3 years, and it is excellent.  It dims a strip of LEDs under the molding on my computer hutch.  It allows for cranking the light up to full brightness for reading things on the desk or dimming it to a pale night light.  It's the perfect control for what is effectively a backlight for my monitor -- the dimmer stops it from being glaring or blinding.

customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWorks, but not with everything
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
customer_reviews.review_snippet: 4 stars, because it does work. Connect it, turn the dial, and your device can go from off to barely on to full power.However -- I got it for an LED lamp that continuously cycles through a range of colors, and it turns out that in order to do that, the power has to be on max. I can have a red glow as dim as I want it, but the color change cycle won't start unless I turn up the power all the way. If I unplug it while on a different color, it comes on red again when I reconnect it, and stays that way unless I turn the power up. I realize this is my lamp's problem, not the dimmer, but since this is probably not an uncommon type of device to want to use this with, you should be warned it may not work for that.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Have some extremely bright LED lights. These allow me to dim them when needed. Also gives me the ability to turn on and off without having to disconnect them from power.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for LEGO light kits
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I bought these to lower the voltage from a USB power brick to the Lighttailing kits I have for some of my LEGO sets and they worked perfectly for dialing in the brightness level and keeping the lights from getting burnt out.One thing to note is that the description says they use a push button to adjust brightness but it’s actually a physical dial which is exactly what I wanted.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNice dimmers, no problems in testing
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Just received these today, they seem like a quality product.  They dim simple USB LED lights like I'd expect them to.  Incidentally, these are the same dimmer switches that came on some rodent/lizard heating pads I recently bought, so it seems like a common part.(I say simple USB LEDs because I know they won't work for complex LED drivers that have their own voltage and current regulating circuits and twinkle/dimming IC).

customer_reviews.review_title: 3.0 out of 5 starsDon’t dim, and take a while to turn on.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Both work decent with my led strip lights. Although they don’t dim them at all, they just turn them on…which is fine, that’s all i really cared about i guess but i would be more happy with it if it didn’t take rolling the switch all the way to the end to turn them on, which is not practical at night. Especially since i have to scroll it 3 times around. also doesn’t allow for the controller use and can only choose one color and one setting.
